alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 19 at 9:52PM CDT until September 19 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Lincoln County in central Oklahoma... Northeastern Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 952 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles east of Johnson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Prague, Meeker, Earlsboro, Cromwell, Johnson, Little, and Centerview. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
